original:
Albrecht Dürer (1471–1528) was a prominent artist of the Northern Renaissance who played a significant role during the early stages of the Protestant Reformation. While he supported Martin Luther's ideas, Dürer continued to create religious works, including Madonnas and other Catholic imagery, alongside portraits of influential figures from both the Catholic and Protestant sides of the Reformation.

Dürer passed away in 1528, prior to t
